meanings.definition: To guide or show the way.
meanings.sent1: She leed her friends through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always leed the students on field trips.
meanings.sent3: The GPS leed them to the wrong destination.
meanings.sent4: His bright flashlight leed the way in the dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse leed ships safely to shore.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a special leed for soldering.
meanings.sent2: The artist crafted beautiful jewelry from leed.
meanings.sent3: The leed roof shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The leed statue stood proudly in the town square.
meanings.sent5: The leed door was heavy and sturdy.

meanings.sent1: She leed the team to victory last year.
meanings.sent2: He leed the discussion during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The detective leed the investigation into the crime.
meanings.sent4: The conductor leed the orchestra with precision.
meanings.sent5: The captain leed his crew through the storm.
